title: AMC Entertainment Refinances Pricey Pandemic Debt
sub_head: The theater company received investor commitments for a money-saving bond deal, despite a selloff that has called into question the longevity of its meme-stock status
body:
AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc. struck a deal to refinance expensive debt it took on in the early days of the pandemic, as it vies to revive the investor enthusiasm that made the company a centerpiece of the meme-stock phenomenon.
On Wednesday, AMC received investor commitments for a new $950 million bond deal and will use the proceeds to pay off higher-interest debt borrowed in April 2020 as an emergency measure after closing the companyâ€™s nearly 1,000 theaters world-wide, people familiar with the matter said.
